title: Designing and making a biochar cook stove with oven in Almere Netherlands May 2024

tasks.task: Operate a riding tractor for field preparation and planting.
subtasks: Sit on the tractor seat and secure seat belt if available.
Adjust the power of the tractor engine using the throttle lever.
Engage or disengage the power take-off (PTO) by interacting with the PTO lever.
Use the suspension system to maintain proper ground contact and balance.
Monitor the diesel fuel level and check if the tank is empty or requires refuelling.
Utilize the front loader for prepping the field prior to plowing.
Lift the front loader bucket to pick up debris, manure, or other materials.
Lower the bucket to deposit materials and level the field.
Adjust the steering to maneuver the tractor and loader accurately across the field.
Engage the tractor's transmission using the Patschke lever for different operating modes.
Switch between gears using the selector lever for efficient movement across the field.
Control the steering direction using the wheel or levers to turn the tractor.
Monitor the direction via the GPS system or manual navigation to stay on course.
Manipulate the hydraulic system to control the depth and angle of the plow's blades.
Leverage the plow attachment to turn over the soil, adjust settings for different soil types.
Coordinate the plow's movement with the tractor's speed for optimal tillage.
Engage and disengage the plow using the lever or buttons provided on the console.
Check for proper attachment of the plow and make adjustments as needed.
Use the GPS system to ensure the plowed rows are straight and evenly spaced.
Operate the planting apparatus suspended beneath the tractor.
Adjust seeder settings for various crops, including depth, furrow width, and seed spacing.
Monitor the seed hopper to ensure an adequate supply of seeds.
Keep the planting wheels and attachments clean and free from obstructions.
Manage the spacing between rows as the tractor moves forward.
Oversee the germination process of the planted seeds under controlled environmental conditions.
Ensure the accuracy of the planted seeds using GPS guidance for precision agriculture.

tasks.task: Perform daily maintenance on a farm's equipment.
subtasks: Inspect the tractor and other machinery for damage or wear during or after use.
Clean the exterior of the tractor to remove dirt and debris.
Check the tractor's fluids, such as oil, coolant, and diesel, and add more if needed.
Lubricate moving parts and replace worn-out lubricants.
Tighten loose bolts or nuts on the tractor's structure and attachments.
Sharpen and replace blades on the plow or other tools as necessary.
Check tire pressure and condition, replacing tires if needed.
Inspect the electrical system, including lights and wiring, for any signs of damage.
Test the emergency brake function and adjust if required.
Verify that all safety components, such as mirrors and guards, are in place and functioning.
Update maintenance logs with details of the inspection and any work performed.

tasks.task: Load hay using a hay loader onto a wagon.
subtasks: Drive the tractor to the hayfield with the hay loader attachment.
Operate the hay loader to grab and lift hay into the wagon.
Position the hay accurately within the wagon for proper stacking.
Check the location of the wagon in relation to the hay parcel to optimize time and effort.
Repeat the process across multiple sections of the hayfield.
Secure the hay tightly in the wagon to prevent spillage during transport.
Cover the hay with protective material if it's necessary to prevent moisture absorption.
Transport the wagon to the storage area, securing the hay if required.

tasks.task: Seed a cabbage field.
subtasks: Choose the appropriate seed variety based on local climate and soil conditions.
Mix the seed with a carrier or fertilizer as per the instructions.
Plant the seeds at the correct depth and spacing, using a seeder or drill.
Maintain proper row distance and ensure even distribution.
Water the newly planted seeds to promote germination.
Apply mulch around the plants to retain soil moisture and suppress weeds.
Monitor the emerging seedlings for problems like damping-off and provide appropriate care.
Fertilize the plants once they reach a certain stage, following the crop's needs.

tasks.task: Unsuccessfully attempt to start a tractor.
subtasks: Open the tractor's engine bay and check for any visible issues.
Listen to the engine for signs of trouble, such as clicking or buzzing sounds.
Check the fuel tank to ensure it is not empty. If necessary, attempt to refuel.
Prim the fuel system by keying the tractor through its operating cycles or manually.
Inspect spark plugs, ensuring they are clean and have proper gap.
Verify the battery terminals are clean and secure, checking for a charged battery.
Check the air filter for blockages and clean or replace if necessary.
Adjust the carburetor or fuel injection settings if the engine is running lean or rich.
Look for any blockages in the fuel lines or filters.
If starting still fails, consult the operator's manual or seek assistance.

tasks.task: Continue plowing a field left by the previous operator.
subtasks: Take over the tractor from where the previous operator left off.
Resume plowing in the abandoned furrows, ensuring even coverage and correct depth.
Makeup any shallow furrows missed due to stopping earlier.
Adjust plow settings for better integration with the existing land topography.
Check for hitches or inconsistencies in the previous work and correct them.
Pay attention to traffic patterns and avoid overlapping furrows where possible.

tasks.task: Maneuver a riding mower for field mowing and cutting.
subtasks: Sit on the mower seat, ensuring the seat is properly adjusted and secure.
Adjust the mower speed using the throttle or PTO controls.
Guide the mower along the designated paths, using the steering wheel or levers.
Oversee the cutting width and adjust any rollers or settings for even cutting.
Watch for uneven terrain or obstacles that may impede the mower's path.
Remove any debris or grass clippings that might clog the mower blades.
Make sure the mower is set to the appropriate deck height based on the crop height.

tasks.task: Operate a front shovel for removing crop residue.
subtasks: Drive the tractor to the field where residue needs to be removed.
Attach the front shovel to the tractor using the quick hitch or drawbar.
Position the shovel over a pile of residue and lower it to scoop the material.
Lift the shovel and deposit the residue into a designated area or bin.
Repeat the process until all residue is cleared from the field.

tasks.task: Drive a tractor with a trailing implement (potato harvester) to a field.
subtasks: Position the tractor in front of the harvester, engaging it through the PTO and hydraulics.
Adjust the spacing of the harvester's narrow blades to match the row width of the potatoes.
Start the harvester's engine and check connections for loose cables or hydraulic lines.
Drive the tractor slowly forward as the harvester digs and hauls the potatoes to the surface.
Monitor the harvester's progress and make adjustments to depth settings as needed.
Tally and load the harvested potatoes onto waiting wagons or trailers.

tasks.task: Fix a broken wheel on a tractor.
subtasks: Secure the tractor to prevent it from moving, either by using the emergency brake or blocking wheels.
Consult the tracto [likely intended as "tractor"] manual for instructions on wheel replacement.
Remove the tire and wheel assembly from the tractor.
Inspect the wheel for damage, replace if necessary.
Replace the wheel bolts or nuts with new ones if they are damaged.
Inflate the tire to the recommended pressure using a pump or air compressor.
Reinstall the tire and align it properly on the wheel hub.
Tighten the wheel nuts diagonally and evenly to ensure proper fit.
Release the tractor from the immobilizing measures (e.g., unblock wheels or release emergency brake) once the wheel is fixed.

tasks.task: Adjust the hydraulics on an implement (potato harvester) while working in a field.
subtasks: Locate the hydraulic control lever or switch on the tractor's console.
Release the safety pin or lock on the hydraulic system if required.
Lower or raise the harvester's digger blades as per the crop's depth and conditions.
Engage or disengage the hydraulic lift using the lever or button on the implement.
Fine-tune the digging angle by manipulating the hydraulic arms if available.
Refer to the harvester's operating manual for the appropriate hydraulic adjustments.
Test the adjusted settings by observing the performance of the digger blades in the field.

tasks.task: Drive a combine harvester through a field.
subtasks: Sit in the combine operator's seat, ensuring comfort and proper adjustment.
Check that the feeding auger is operational and adjust the feeder-house gap for the crop type.
Adjust the combine's settings for cutting height, folding header position, or drum speed, depending on the desired header type (middles, reel).
Monitor the grain tank level and ensure it remains at a safe operating capacity.
Check and adjust the combine's header for proper crop gathering, ensuring no plants are left unharvested.
Tend to the unload system, ensuring the grain auger or conveyor is working properly.
Periodically check the separation and cleaning mechanisms to ensure grain quality.
Keep an eye on the ground speed of the combine to maximize efficiency.

tasks.task: Attach and detach implements to a tractor.
subtasks: Identify the appropriate implement for the task at hand, e.g., plow, mower, or harvester.
Approach the implement with the tractor and align it for connection.
Raise the rear lift arm or activate the Quick Hitch to connect the implement.
Secure the hitch pins or locks in place once the implement is attached.
Test the connection by moving the tractor slowly to ensure stability.
Repeat the process to detach the implement, releasing the hitch pins or disconnecting the Quick Hitch.
Stow the implement properly in the field or shed, or transport it back to the barn.

tasks.task: Drain fuel from a tractor.
subtasks: Open the fuel system of the tractor, typically located on the fuel tank or at the filler neck.
Position a container under the drain spout to collect the fuel.
Use a hose or tube to transfer the fuel to another container if necessary.
Wait for the remaining fuel to drain completely, possibly rinsing and priming the system.
Secure the drain spout and clean up any spills.

tasks.task: Adjust GPS steering on a tractor for precision agriculture.
subtasks: Enter the desired field boundaries and tine settings into the GPS system.
GPS calibrate the tractor's position relative to the pre-planned route.
Program auto-steer functionality to follow pre-determined paths.
Check that the guidance system is operational and make manual adjustments if necessary.
Monitor the GPS alignment during operations to ensure accurate coverage.

tasks.task: Apply herbicides to a wheat field.
subtasks: Select the appropriate herbicide mix for the current growth stage of wheat.
Calibrate the boom sprayer or tank mix applicator for coverage and droplet size.
Mix the herbicide in the sprayer tanks according to label directions.
Adjust the sprayer pressure and nozzle spacing for optimal drift control.
Drive the tractor, pulling the applicator, ensuring proper overlap for complete coverage.
Check the spray boom or lance direction and adjust as needed to cover the field uniformly.
Monitor the remaining chemical supply in the tanks and plan for refills.

tasks.task: Assemble a team of laborers for planting potatoes.
subtasks: Coordinate with farmhands to schedule their availability for the planting task.
Distribute planting instructions and discuss the potato variety, spacings, and depth.
Equip workers with necessary tools, such as seed potatoes, spades, and shovels.
Train laborers on proper planting techniques to minimize damage and optimize spacing.
Oversee the planting process, ensuring quality control in row alignment and plant spacing.

tasks.task: Clear a wet field of hay by driving a front loader.
subtasks: Drive the tractor to the wet hayfield with the front loader attachment.
Attach the loader bucket to the tractor and position it appropriately.
Dig trenches or furrows to facilitate drainage in the field.
Load excess soil from trenches onto a neighboring plot or structure.
Apply manure or compost to the hayfield to improve fertility if time allows.

tasks.task: Operate a planted field under irrigation.
subtasks: Check the irrigation system's functionality, including pivot or sprinkler heads.
Start the irrigation process, ensuring even distribution of water across the field.
Adjust the flow rate and pressure manually if needed.
Monitor the water application rate to prevent over-irrigation or dry spots.
Keep an eye on weather conditions and modulate irrigation timing as necessary.

tasks.task: Ferment silage in a silo.
subtasks: Check the readiness of ensiled crops, such as maize or barley.
Fill the silo with the fermented crops, packing them tightly to minimize air pockets.
Monitor the silage's moisture content and ensure optimal conditions for fermentation.
Cover the silo's opening with tarp or plastic to prevent oxygen penetration and loss of quality.
